reviews.review: UNA OBRA MAESTRA

Its wonderful even after all this time, but unlike Half Life 1, it can feel like its trying to impress you with the physics engine technology sometimes instead of just being a cool game. 

Still, a game that any PC gamer should play at least once, with a good story and gameplay loop. Sometimes hit-scan shooting enemies can feel a bit gross though if you play on hard. Playing on M-Mod on hard with better combine aim was kind awful at one specific part where I had to defend alyx, but this is my own fault.
yes

Valve'ın oyun dünyasına kattığı cevherlerden biri, belki de en değerlisi. Zamanın çok ötesinde olan bir oyun. Grafikleri mi dersin, hikaye sunumu mu dersin, fizikleri ve oynanışı mı dersin her şeyi zamanı için devrim sayılacak nitelikte olan bir oyundu ve hala da oynanabilirliği oldukça yüksek. Optimizasyonunun da görüntü kalitesine oranla başarılı olduğunu belirtmeliyim. Akılda kalıcı müzikleri ve gizem dolu hikayesini de övmezsem ayıp etmiş olurum. Konuşmadığın halde bizlere çok şey anlattın Gordon Freeman...

Un clásico de clásicos. La historia mas los gráficos y lo fluido que se deja jugar sin necesidad de mucha maquina lo hacen excelente para mi caso. Muy atrapante, desafiante pero no difícil de jugar, es muy intuitivo. Del 0 al 10 le pongo un 15

Hardly aged a day.

Half-Life 2 is the reason I downloaded Steam all those many years ago and I consider it to be a classic and a must-have in anyone's library. Having said that, I admit it might not hold up so much without the nostalgia tinted glasses but I just recently played through it again and I enjoyed it just as much as I did when it was new. I blasted through it in 11 hours so it's not a big time commitment.

If you want to check it out I recommend getting The Orange Box bundle which comes with this, the two follow up episodes, the first Portal, and Team Fortress 2 (which is free to play now anyway).

Half-Life 2 is a must for anyone that loves gaming. The Half-Life franchise really started the whole first-person-shooter genre that focused on storytelling. Before Half-life there weren't really any game that tried to tell stories this way. 

I would compare playing Half-Life 2 to watching a great movie. It has so many elements that just work so well that it really is like a movie, where you are interacting throughout the game. 

In my opinion this game still stands on it's own. If you want to enhance the graphics there is mods out there that will do that for you. But to be honest the graphics are just fine on it's own. When this game came out in 2004 it set a new bar for how far a game could go. 

I still play this on a yearly basis. It is that good.
Obra Maestra, muy divertido

What do you expect of a FPS game? Smooth game play? No so clumsy side characters? Realistic physics? Not too easy but not too hard strategies (Well, I completed the game in 12 hours)? A good story line?
 This game has it all, the amount of thumbs up on its page makes it clear enough.
It's Half-Life 2. 'Nuff said. It's pretty good.

I'm not going to be talking much about the story in this review (which is amazing btw) as much as I'll be talking about game-play and mechanics.

This game is quite a bit different from your average fps campaign, effective long range weapons are few and far between and most engagements are going to be at close or medium range. You're rewarded for saving the ammo of your more powerful weapons (python revolver, crossbow, rocket launcher) for the appropriate situation, and you may find yourself caught out if you use your ammunition recklessly.

The grav gun is a truly original weapon and you can beat the game using it almost exclusively if you choose to. You can hold larger objects out front of yourself as a makeshift shield to advance on turrets, use it as a pseudo grenade launcher by rolling a grenade onto the ground and picking it up with the grav gun which lets you easily cook the grenade before launching it, use it to stack up boxes to get to unintended places. There are so many different ways to use the grav gun it's kind of mind-boggling.

The closest thing to a classic AR type weapon in this game is the AR2 Overwatch Pulse Rifle, which compared to ARs from a game like Counter Strike has horrible first shot accuracy and lots of spread. However it's still workable if you burst fire and aim for center mass at long range.

You'll probably be using the shotgun a lot, it's OP and there is ammo everywhere for it.

Bhopping is super easy in this game. No need to airstrafe, just hold W and make sure you jump as soon as you hit the ground. If you use your sprint and Bhop together you can gain quite a bit of speed, it's really useful for bypassing obstacles quickly and darting past enemies into cover.

Anyways this game is an easy 10/10 and it has aged quite well IMO
